data.name: Square a number without +, *, -, /, Math and eval
data.description: Write a function which taken an integer in the range of (-46340, 46340) and returns the square of that integer. Sounds simple, doesn't it? Oh, but you are not allowed to use any of the basic arithmetic operands +, -, \*, \*\* and /. Also the `Math` class is not allowed, same applies for the `eval` function and external libraries. For your sample tests the arithmetic operands are not tested to get you started more easily, but you can not pass with them included. To make things a little more compact, just solve this Kata in 200 characters or less. The reference solution has exactly 99 characters, so this should be easy for you! ;-) This kata was inspired by: One line task: Square a number Without *, + or Math.pow()
